titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John Cookendofer, Indictment
CWG9279

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Bracken Circuit Court
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
John Cookendofer
The Grand Jury of Bracken County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse John Cookendofer of the crime of Stealing a Horse, committed as follows to wit:

The said John Cookendofer on the day of August 1856 in the County aforesaid feloniously did steal, take and carry away a certain Horse, the personal property of Louisa Fields, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses
Newton Downard
Thomas Fields
Sharp Foster

A copy att
R J. Hughey C B C Ct
